tweets.text: @EnvAgency If you are refusing to do a site visit and sample the discharge and you are refusing to accept a sample I have collected, then we need to know who is suitable for collecting a sample and what parameters are acceptable in order to prove pollution is still occurring.

@IronAgeFort @EnvAgency Waisting your time with the EA I repeatedly reported pollution incidents on the Gaywood river July/Aug & EA found nothing Collected sample & tested by @N_Rivers_Trust Ammonia 480mg Phosphate 80mg per litre & solids off the scale EA finally accepted there was a problem ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüí©üíÄüêü https://t.co/xU6G2bRKDx

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

Flood alert along #Sheppey and north #Kent coast issued by the @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/iAWSRv56L5 https://t.co/hXSHXlI0hR

2/2 What flow reading do you deem safe/require for the divers to complete the work? And when does this work expect to be finished by, if it‚Äôs begun at the earliest the flow reading drops? I‚Äôm sure you understand, I‚Äôm eager to get an answer after this long

The Water Environment Grant, Esk Restoration project is in full swing! Here's NYMNPA staff planting riparian vegetation at Ainthorpeüåø. The vegetation acts as a buffer, helping reduce sediment runoff from land, supporting improved water quality. @northyorkmoors  @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/1ToX8Uwpou

Last chance to book your place at our online conference #WasteManagement2020! Don't miss out on hearing from @EnvAgency @AdlerandAllan @VertaseFLI @hydrocknews @gunnercooke @atkinsglobal @i2Analytical @GEA_Ltd
& Somerton Environmental

Book here: https://t.co/lZiwwPJOqL https://t.co/2KkE2VZfN5

Inspected the new  Blue Green infrastructure project along Valley Rd this morning. Flood Mitigation ‚úÖ Biodiversity ‚úÖ Visual Enhancement ‚úÖ  Great Partnership Working ‚úÖ. Looking forward to seeing the site Green up in the spring! @mhclg @EnvAgency @MyNottingham @apsetweets https://t.co/mFjXg77Je0

In preparation for the #SalisburyRiverPark project, ground investigation work will take place at Ashley Road and the Maltings. Any ground disturbances are hoped to be reinstated in the Spring @EnvAgencySW @wiltscouncil @SWLEP https://t.co/CdJSCn4vDe

@EnvAgency 3 sets of drainage works have been done to this sewage system, the last being November 2019.  This sample was collected in January 2020 and clearly there is still an issue which needs investigating.

Sample collected January 2020 from private sewage system outfall pipe discharging onto surface of land.

Comment from EA "The sample does not have the continuity of evidence that we would require and has not been taken by a recognised individual with authority" ü§î https://t.co/qMeSpEH1Dg

Works start today to the #ParkdeanRiverbank #WestBay for the next 16 weeks. Improvements to the River Brit riverbank will provide protection against the river overflowing üë®‚Äçüè≠#flooding @DorsetCouncilUK @EnvAgencySW @BridportTIC https://t.co/oIzE04zSm7 https://t.co/IE11jQRe2q

Condition of the site 12th November 2020

Suspended solids clearly visible on the surface of the ground (no rainfall to wash particles away)

Pooling effluent

Waterlogged and boggy ground (the only area of the field that is like this is immediately below a sewage pipe)

üòïü§îü§®üò£ https://t.co/O2BzzoFuf7

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM surely this depends where a barrier is built. A barrier built futher downstream can make the river course a reservoir of astonomical capacity. The tidal range is what 13m? How many cubic metres is that? Surely eneough to take fluvial flow even in extreme conditions. More evidence
